articles.headline: Judge in Trump Documents Case Rejected Suggestions to Step Aside
articles.snippet: Two federal judges in South Florida privately urged Aileen M. Cannon to decline the case when it was assigned to her last year, according to two people briefed on the matter. She chose to keep it.
articles.abstract: Two federal judges in South Florida privately urged Aileen M. Cannon to decline the case when it was assigned to her last year, according to two people briefed on the matter. She chose to keep it.
articles.lead_paragraph: Shortly after Judge Aileen M. Cannon drew the assignment in June 2023 to oversee former President Donald J. Trump’s classified documents case, two more experienced colleagues on the federal bench in Florida urged her to pass it up and hand it off to another jurist, according to two people briefed on the conversations.
articles.byline: By Charlie Savage and Alan Feuer

articles.headline: Democrats’ Dream of a Wealth Tax Is Alive. For Now.
articles.snippet: A narrow Supreme Court ruling left the door open for Congress to expand taxes on billionaires, but it’s not a guarantee.
articles.abstract: A narrow Supreme Court ruling left the door open for Congress to expand taxes on billionaires, but it’s not a guarantee.
articles.lead_paragraph: For years, liberal Democrats have agitated for the United States to tax wealth, not just income, as a way to ensure that rich Americans who derive wealth from real estate, stocks, bonds and other assets were paying more in taxes.

articles.headline: TikTok Lays Out Past Efforts to Address U.S. Concerns
articles.snippet: The company said the disclosures support its argument that a law signed by President Biden in May is unconstitutional.
articles.abstract: The company said the disclosures support its argument that a law signed by President Biden in May is unconstitutional.
articles.lead_paragraph: TikTok detailed on Thursday why it thinks the new federal law that could lead to a ban of the popular video app in January is unconstitutional, calling the legislation an “extraordinary restriction on speech.”

articles.headline: French Business Leaders See Threat to Economy From Macron’s Opponents
articles.snippet: Executives challenged the anti-immigration policies of the far-right candidate Jordan Bardella and spending plans by a left-wing coalition at a packed gathering in Paris.
articles.abstract: Executives challenged the anti-immigration policies of the far-right candidate Jordan Bardella and spending plans by a left-wing coalition at a packed gathering in Paris.
articles.lead_paragraph: Both the far-right National Rally party in France and its competing left-wing New Popular Front coalition are promising to save the country from financial ruin.

articles.headline: The Taylor Swift Economy Has Landed in Europe
articles.snippet: Economists are debating what effect the singer’s sweep through Europe will have this summer as swarms of fans increase demand for hotels and services.
articles.abstract: Economists are debating what effect the singer’s sweep through Europe will have this summer as swarms of fans increase demand for hotels and services.
articles.lead_paragraph: It’s not just Taylor Swift fans keeping a close eye on her Eras Tour dates. One of Europe’s most prominent economists is acutely aware that the singer is spending the summer jetting between Europe’s stadiums.

articles.headline: The Opaque Industry Secretly Inflating Prices for Prescription Drugs
articles.snippet: Pharmacy benefit managers are driving up drug costs for millions of people, employers and the government.
articles.abstract: Pharmacy benefit managers are driving up drug costs for millions of people, employers and the government.
articles.lead_paragraph: Americans are paying too much for prescription drugs.
articles.byline: By Rebecca Robbins and Reed Abelson

articles.headline: Editor Tapped to Lead Washington Post Won’t Take the Job
articles.snippet: Robert Winnett will stay at The Daily Telegraph, after reports raised questions about his ties to unethical news gathering practices.
articles.abstract: Robert Winnett will stay at The Daily Telegraph, after reports raised questions about his ties to unethical news gathering practices.
articles.lead_paragraph: Robert Winnett, the editor selected to run The Washington Post, will not take up that position, after reports raised questions about his ties to unethical news gathering practices in Britain.
articles.byline: By Benjamin Mullin and Katie Robertson

articles.headline: As Ukraine Expands Military Draft, Some Men Go Into Hiding
articles.snippet: Fearful that conscription is a one-way ticket to bloody trench warfare, the men spend their days holed up at home to avoid draft officers who roam the streets.
articles.abstract: Fearful that conscription is a one-way ticket to bloody trench warfare, the men spend their days holed up at home to avoid draft officers who roam the streets.
articles.lead_paragraph: First, Vladyslav stopped going into Kyiv’s city center to avoid draft officers checking papers. Then he stopped exercising at the gym because of patrols in his neighborhood. Now, he spends most of his days holed up in his apartment, often using his binoculars to watch officers serving draft notices to commuters leaving a nearby subway station.

articles.headline: 260 McNuggets? McDonald’s Ends A.I. Drive-Through Tests Amid Errors
articles.snippet: Ordering mistakes frustrated customers during nearly three years of tests. But competitors like White Castle and Wendy’s say their A.I. ordering systems have been highly accurate.
articles.abstract: Ordering mistakes frustrated customers during nearly three years of tests. But competitors like White Castle and Wendy’s say their A.I. ordering systems have been highly accurate.
articles.lead_paragraph: In the nearly three years since McDonald’s announced that it was partnering with IBM to develop a drive-through order taker powered by artificial intelligence, videos popped up on social media showing confused and frustrated customers trying to correct comically inaccurate meals.

articles.headline: Supreme Court Upholds Law Disarming Domestic Abusers
articles.snippet: The decision amounted to a retreat from what had been an unbroken series of major decisions expanding gun rights that started in 2008.
articles.abstract: The decision amounted to a retreat from what had been an unbroken series of major decisions expanding gun rights that started in 2008.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court ruled on Friday that the government can take guns away from people subject to restraining orders for domestic violence, limiting the sweep of a blockbuster decision in 2022 that had vastly expanded Second Amendment rights.

articles.headline: Boeing May Evade Criminal Charges for Violating Settlement
articles.snippet: The Justice Department could require the aircraft maker to install an independent federal monitor to oversee safety and quality issues. Prosecutors have not made a final call on bringing charges.
articles.abstract: The Justice Department could require the aircraft maker to install an independent federal monitor to oversee safety and quality issues. Prosecutors have not made a final call on bringing charges.
articles.lead_paragraph: The Justice Department is considering allowing Boeing to avoid criminal prosecution for violating the terms of a 2021 settlement related to problems with the company’s 737 Max 8 model that led to two deadly plane crashes in 2018 and 2019, according to people familiar with the discussions.
articles.byline: By Mark Walker and Glenn Thrush

articles.headline: Israeli Official Describes Secret Government Bid to Cement Control of West Bank
articles.snippet: Israeli judges have long ruled that Israel’s control of the territory is a temporary military occupation and complies with international law. A powerful minister’s recent speech, caught on tape, suggested the government is trying to change that.
articles.abstract: Israeli judges have long ruled that Israel’s control of the territory is a temporary military occupation and complies with international law. A powerful minister’s recent speech, caught on tape, suggested the government is trying to change that.
articles.lead_paragraph: An influential member of Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu’s coalition told settlers in the Israeli-occupied West Bank that the government is engaged in a stealthy effort to irreversibly change the way the territory is governed, to cement Israel’s control over it without being accused of formally annexing it.
articles.byline: By Natan Odenheimer, Ronen Bergman and Patrick Kingsley
